DOC.brief_summary: Young men sex men ( YMSM ) account almost 70 % HIV diagnose among young people U.S. alone face increase rate infection . Because YMSM less likely receive relevant sexual health education traditional setting ( e.g . school , community ) , Internet unique route reach help YMSM . The purpose study compare two different version online HIV prevention program YMSM . The study conduct researcher Northwestern University Chicago , Hunter College New York City , Emory University Atlanta . A total 900 YMSM enrol study clinic community partner Chicago , New York , Atlanta . Participants randomly assign one two version program . Some topics program include HIV fact myth , sexually transmit infection ( STIs ) , condom use . All participant , regardless program version receive , also take at-home urine rectal test STIs chlamydia gonorrhea . After complete program , participant contact three time course year follow-up session survey . The research team hypothesize YMSM-specific prevention program lead significant reduction frequency unprotected anal sex act new STI infection compare HIV knowledge program general audience . The YMSM-specific program also lead improvement secondary knowledge , motivation , skills outcome . In order research team measure effectiveness YMSM-specific prevention program determine study hypothesis correct , participant ask question , include question sexual orientation , sexual experience , health practice , include drug use , health knowledge , question feeling emotion . Based information , research team hop later change , improve , expand program good address need YMSM .
DOC.brief_title: Keep It Up ! 2.0 : A Comparison Two Online HIV Intervention Programs Young Men Who Have Sex With Men
